qas.question: Name a compond that can mobilize sold copper?
What fungi can grow in copper metalliferous soils?
What fungus protects pine trees from copper toxicity?
What fungus grows from gold mining solution?
What fungus helps to soften heavy metal sulfides?
What is the only compound that can mobilize solid copper?
What fungi can speak in copper metalliferous soils?
What fungus makes pine trees vulnerable to copper toxicity?
What fungus grows from diamond mining solution?
What fungus helps to toxify heavy metal sulfides?

context: <a0_0>Chromobacterium violaceum<a0_0/> and <b5_0>Pseudomonas fluorescens<b5_0/> can both mobilize solid copper, as a cyanide compound. The <a1_0><b6_0>ericoid mycorrhizal fungi<b6_0/><a1_0/> associated with Calluna, Erica and Vaccinium can grow in copper metalliferous soils. The ectomycorrhizal fungus <a2_0><b7_0>Suillus luteus<b7_0/><a2_0/> protects young pine trees from copper toxicity. A sample of the <a4_0><b9_0>fungus <a3_0><b8_0>Aspergillus<a4_0/> niger<b9_0/><b8_0/><a3_0/> was found growing from gold mining solution; and was found to contain cyano metal complexes; such as gold, silver, copper iron and zinc. The fungus also plays a role in the solubilization of heavy metal sulfides.
